column4: Has anyone got experience with switching a Desktop Ubuntu to the Sever edition?
just switch kernels and don't start GDM in your default runlevel, and you're done.
I have all my files on my account on the system, will they get affected?
You're not changing the system at all.
So when I've installed the server, is there any fancy webcontrole interface which I can manage the system by default?
no.  Servers doing have a GUI - that's kinda the point.
or do I have to install like webmin?
webmin is not supported nor recommended.
strict?  It serves...what more do you want?
although I don't have a problem working with ssh and such.... I was kinda expecting a webinterface to connect to it and manage it from there in all comodity. :)
The reason such a thing is not included is because those types of control interfaces have serious security issues, and the technical board prefers to ship a secure product than a "convenient" one.
ok I get it. But the sever is like, pure server, and not a Home Server?
define "home server"?  You can set up whatever programs you need.
Well by "strict server" I mean the "hardcore" stuff like you mean, and by "Home server" I am picturing the comodity stuff
I don't understand.  I run the exact same things on my "home server" as my "corporate servers".
so it's just the same thing, different name depending on the location of the server :D
sure
gonna make myself a toaster server in that case :D
to match your dead badger server?
yeah, he was starting to get smelly and scare the kids....
... and get everyone sick when making toast :D
thx for the help, guess there's no real need for me to run my system with another kernel since I use the server-side apps already on the desktop
